Tab

This class inject Pmog featurees into the Firefox tab.

Summary
Tab
This class inject Pmog featurees into the Firefox tab.
Functions
Tab
Initializes the Object
whenPageLoad
This function is triggered when content of a tab loads.
handle_loaded_page
This method is triggered when a page has been loaded.
parse_selected_tab
When a tab is loaded it notifies the Pmog class (only once).
notify_pmog
Only tell Pmog about the tab once so that it doesn’t get tracked repeatly.
is_tab_selected
Determine if this tab is the currently selected one.
isTopLevelDocument
Determine if the document in question is the top most document and not an iframe or similar.
getLocation
Get as many attributes about the current location as possible.
getDocument
Returns the document element associated with this tab.

Functions

Tab

Tab = function(panel_id,
browser,
tab_observer)

Initializes the Object

Parameters

panel_idthe id corresponding to the Tab in firefox to associate this instance with.
browserThe browser xul element inside firefox.
tab_observerThe instance of the TabObserver class that created this tab.

whenPageLoad

Tab.prototype.whenPageLoad = function(event,
listener_index)

This function is triggered when content of a tab loads.  Once all the cotent of the tab is loaded it makes a callback

Parameters

eventthe object that triggered the onload event.
listener_indexthe position within the listener array that corresponds to the listener assigned to this tab.

handle_loaded_page

Tab.prototype.handle_loaded_page = function(doc)

This method is triggered when a page has been loaded.

Parameters

docThe document element of the loaded page.

parse_selected_tab

Tab.prototype.parse_selected_tab = function()

When a tab is loaded it notifies the Pmog class (only once).

notify_pmog

Tab.prototype.notify_pmog = function()

Only tell Pmog about the tab once so that it doesn’t get tracked repeatly.

is_tab_selected

Tab.prototype.is_tab_selected = function()

Determine if this tab is the currently selected one.

Returns

true or false

isTopLevelDocument

Tab.prototype.isTopLevelDocument = function(aDocument)

Determine if the document in question is the top most document and not an iframe or similar.

Parameters

aDocumentThe document element to test.

getLocation

Tab.prototype.getLocation = function()

Get as many attributes about the current location as possible.

Returns

An object containing attributes for “host”, “hostname”, “href”, “pathname”, “port”, “protocol”, and “search”.

getDocument

Tab.prototype.getDocument = function()

Returns the document element associated with this tab.

Tab = function(panel_id,
browser,
tab_observer)
Initializes the Object
Tab.prototype.whenPageLoad = function(event,
listener_index)
This function is triggered when content of a tab loads.
Tab.prototype.handle_loaded_page = function(doc)
This method is triggered when a page has been loaded.
Tab.prototype.parse_selected_tab = function()
When a tab is loaded it notifies the Pmog class (only once).
This class is the controller for the extension.
Tab.prototype.notify_pmog = function()
Only tell Pmog about the tab once so that it doesn’t get tracked repeatly.
Tab.prototype.is_tab_selected = function()
Determine if this tab is the currently selected one.
Tab.prototype.isTopLevelDocument = function(aDocument)
Determine if the document in question is the top most document and not an iframe or similar.
Tab.prototype.getLocation = function()
Get as many attributes about the current location as possible.
Tab.prototype.getDocument = function()
Returns the document element associated with this tab.
The purpose of this class is to keep track of all tabs loaded by firefox.
